activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquin K Young

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Marquin K Young in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet. Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
Defendant did test negative at RCAP.
BTC: Defendant is to go to SPD office after court.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 9/8/2022 to allow for employment and or schooling on GPS

10:16 AM Defendant Marquin K Young in court.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Defendant is still trying to get an attorney and requests GPS time extended for school. State does not object to modification.
BTC: Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Matter to set over to get an attorney. Court will modify bond to allow GPS for employment and or schooling.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. 1:57 PM Defendant Marquin K Young appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Marquin K Young.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Return of property hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
